title.narrative: Unicef Complementary decision: Integrated Social Protection Progr. for Children
Unicef Kompletterande insatsbeslut: Integrerat socialt skyddsprogram för barn

description.narrative: A contribution that consists of two components, namely cash assistance and social services to children.

Detta är en komplettering till tidigare beslut om stöd till UNICEFs program (10332, Catch-Up schools och Drop-Out Programme, se avtalsändringbrev daterad 2017-08-07 i Dox). Ett nytt avtal tecknas efter förfrågan om stöd främst till en kontantinsasts för sårbara barn i Jordanien från UNICEF till Sida. Ett icke-tematiskt stöd lämnas i detta så att specifik rapportering för detta program kan erhållas.
UNICEF i Jordanien har inkommit med förslag till ett stöd för ett integrerat socialt skyddsprogram för barn i Jordanien där ett kontant stöd ingår. Syftet är att ge kontant stöd till sårbara familjer för att deras barn skall kunna gå i skolan och att barnen får socialhjälp. Mottagare av kontantstödet kommer att få överföringarna via ett iris-scan system. Insatsen genomförs under 2017-2018 och Sida bidrar med 10 000 000 kr.

The intervention aims to Enhance access to basic services and livelihood for vulnerable school-aged children (Syrian refugees, Jordanians and others), either at risk of dropping out of school or currently out of school, and support their enrolment and retention in education services over a period of 12 months. The only difference between this project and the previous one is that the first one was solely focusing on social protection, however this project includes a major component on social protection and a small component on non-formal education (drop out specifically). This project has 2 specific objectives: 1) Drop-out rate decreases and enrollment rate increases in primary schools, following alleviation of financial pressure on vulnerable families. 2) Access to certified non-formal education increases and expands for vulnerable young women and men currently not eligible for public schools

policy-marker.narrative: Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Convention on Biological Diversity
Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Convention to Combat Desertification
Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Framework Convention on Climate Change - Adaptation
Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Framework Convention on Climate Change - Mitigation
Reproductive, Maternal, Newborn and Child Health (RMNCH)

description.narrative: This intervention has contributed to 3,596 vulnerable children accessing education, where there has been an increase of 2.6 per cent in enrolment in primary schools in Child Cash Grants (CCG) targeted district and a decrease of 11% of absences decreased by 11 per cent in primary schools in CCG targeted district. This intervention allowed children (who are the target group of this intervention) to access schools through supporting the household by 20 Jordanian Dinars (JOD) per child per month to cover direct and indirect costs of education as well as linked them to additional services such as case management, psychosocial support, and child protection services which increased the retention rates which was not possible without this intervention. Additionally, this intervention benefited 9,028 households that were beneficiaries of Hajati. They received bi-weekly reminders on the importance of education with information on additional support available to guarantee their children’s school attendance.
No indicator available - only a description of the activity results is published
